results.title: Following their footsteps
results.brief_description: The small towns of Kernot and Grantville in south-eastern Victoria, depend on volunteer emergency services to ensure that when fires break out, car accidents happen or cats are stuck in trees, that someone is there to help. Who better to have on call than local legend Barrie Stewart and the dedicated members of the Kernot/Grantville CFA.

results.title: Following the plough
results.brief_description: A tour of contemporary Canadian agriculture led by a modern troubador whose work on the land moves him to song. What is seen is farming as big business coast-to-coast, mechanised, automated, where the farmer is businessman, scientist, world citizen, but still a man with a desire for independence and his own place on the land.

results.title: Follow you follow me
results.brief_description: Examines the complexities in the friendship of two teenage boys - one a shy thirteen year old whose father owns a factory, and the other a confident extrovert whose father is an employee and shop steward at this same factory. An industrial dispute directly affects this friendship and the intensity of their feelings is revealed.

results.title: Follow the leader
results.brief_description: A supervisory training film which makes use of puppets. Designed to increase employee pride in and identification with the organisation. It also aims to make employees understand and be proud of their job and their skill at performing it.

results.title: Follow the fleet
results.creator_credit: Mark Sandrich, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Hubert Osborne’s play “Shore leave”, this romantic comedy musical features that wonderful dancing duo, Fred Astaire as Bake Baker, a sailor, and Ginger Rogers as Sherry Martin, a dance-hall hostess. Although playing more of a supportive role to Randolph Scott and Harriet Hilliard, the Fred and Ginger team put in an unforgettable performance with “Let’s face the music and dance”. Cast also includes Betty Grable and Lucille Ball. Lyrics and music by Irving Berlin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Sandrich, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures

results.title: Follow that camel
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Peter Rogers Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
England, 1906, and all is not cricket. After being tricked and humiliated at a high society club during a cricket match, Bertram West aka Beau (Jim Dale), now disgraced, leaves with batsman Simpson (Peter Butterworth) to join the Foreign Legion to prove his worth. Hot on Beau’s tail is the regretful Lady Jane Ponsonby (Angela Douglas) who travels to restore his reputation whilst losing her own. The usual Carry On crew are joined by Phil Silvers who reprises the Sergeant Bilko character in his role as Sergeant Knocker. A strong performance but distracting from the usual Carry On style. A few saucy surprises along the way, like Anita Harris who, usually type-cast as the wholesome girl next door, plays the shock role (for it’s time), of the erotic belly dancer. Cast includes: Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims and Bernard Bresslaw.

results.title: Follow that bird
results.creator_credit: Ken Kwapis, Tony Garnett and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Big Bird goes to stay with the Dodo family in Illinois, but soon realizes he really belongs with the variety of inhabitants on Sesame Street. Adapted from the very popular children’s television series, “Sesame Street”, this wonderful muppet film features Oscar, Bert, Ernie, Cookie Monster and many of the other loved characters from the television show. Delightful entertainment for all the family. Stars Chevy Chase, Sandra Bernhard, Waylon Jennings, Dave Thomas and John Candy in cameo roles and the voices of Carroll Spinney, Jim Henson, Frank Oz, Paul Bartel and others.

results.title: Follow my leader
results.brief_description: A Girl Guide Company requires a new leader. No-one is available so the Company carries on as best it can. Finally the Guides erect notices promoting a display of what they do and before too long they get a volunteer for a new leader and also new recruits.

results.title: Folk, Rhythm and Life
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Skermer Famliy have been running the Bilyana ‘Folk Rhythm & Life Festival’, in north-eastern Victoria, since 1996 and in the process raising funds for local and international charities. The festival has always been environmentally sustainable, with the original “drop dunnies” developed by Hamish Skermer now being used not only in Eldorado but also at festivals in Australia and overseas.
